text: The petrol price was on Monday cut by Rs. 3.02 per litre, but diesel rates were hiked by Rs.1.47 a litre, the second increase this month in line with global trends. Petrol in Delhi will cost Rs. 56.61 per litre as against Rs. 59.63. A litre of diesel, however, will cost Rs 46.43 as compared with Rs 44.96 per litre earlier, according to the Indian Oil Corp, the nation’s largest fuel retailer.This is the seventh straight reduction in the price of petrol.Petrol price was last cut on February 18 by 32 paisa a litre. “The current level of international product prices of petrol and diesel and rupee-dollar exchange rate warrants decrease in the price of petrol and increase in the price of diesel”, IOC said. —PTI
title: Petrol price cut by Rs.3
